ul.li: compatibility is only achieved between AIM and MIM schemas; entities defined in the ARMs may have different name and structure;
ISO 10303-214 formal rules have sometimes been renamed or splitted in several rules, located in various specific modules.

ext_description.note: This clause specifies rules that apply to the entity data types defined or imported through USE FROM statements. In some cases, these rules do not correspond to constraints specified in the ARM of the present module but reflect constraints specified in imported modules. For example, most of the dependent_instantiable rules are related to the fact that in the modules where the constrained MIM entity is defined, the corresponding construct in the ARM is an attribute and not an entity. That is, in particular, the case for many role attributes. However, as the constrained MIM entity may be used in various modules and with various constraints, it is only at the level of the application protocol or of a conformance class that a formal rule applied to the MIM entity can be specified, synthesising the constraints applied to this MIM entity in all the imported modules.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A schema_name constant is an uppercase representation of the name of the present Express schema.

The approval_person_organization_requires_date_time rule specifies that each instance of approval_person_organization shall be referenced by exactly one of either applied_date_assignment or applied_date_and_time_assignment where the assigned date or date and time specifies the sign off date of the approval.
This rule enforces the requirement for every approval, that, in case the approving person or organization is specified, also the sign off date of the Approval has to be given.

There shall be exactly one instance of either applied_date_assignment or applied_date_and_time_assignment associated to an approval_person_organization where the name of date_role, respectively date_time_role, is 'sign off'.

The approval_requires_approval_assignment rule specifies that each instance of approval is referenced by at least one instance of approval_assignment as the assigned_approval.
This rule enforces the requirement for every approval to be applied at least once.
Each instance of approval shall be referenced at least once as the assigned_approval by an instance of approval_assignment.
The dependent_instantiable_derived_unit rule specifies that each instance of derived_unit shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of derived_unit that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_document_usage_role rule specifies that each instance of document_usage_role shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of document_usage_role that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_measure_with_unit rule specifies that each instance of measure_with_unit shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of measure_with_unit that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_named_unit rule specifies that each instance of named_unit shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of named_unit that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_precision_qualifier rule specifies that each instance of precision_qualifier shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of precision_qualifier that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_product_definition_context_role rule specifies that each instance of product_definition_context_role shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of product_definition_context_role that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_standard_uncertainty rule specifies that each instance of standard_uncertainty shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of standard_uncertainty that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_time_interval_role rule specifies that each instance of time_interval_role shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of time_interval_role that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_type_qualifier rule specifies that each instance of type_qualifier shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of type_qualifier that is not referred to by another instance.
The dependent_instantiable_uncertainty_qualifier rule specifies that each instance of uncertainty_qualifier shall be referred by at least another instance.
There shall not be any instance of uncertainty_qualifier that is not referred to by another instance.
The dimensionality_is_two_or_three rule ensures that all representations with a geometric_representation_context are defined in a two-dimensional or three-dimensional coordinate system.
Each geometric_representation_context shall have a coordinate_space_dimension equal to two or three.

The event_occurrence_requires_event_occurrence_assignment rule ensures that each instance of event_occurrence that serves not as a base for another instance of event_occurrence is referenced by at least one instance of event_occurrence_assignment as the assigned_event_occurrence.
This rule enforces the requirement for every event_reference to be assigned to product data at least once.

Each event_occurrence that is not used as a base_event by an instance of relative_event_occurrence shall be used at least once as the assigned_event_occurrence of an instance of event_occurrence_assignment.
The global_length_and_angle_units_2d_or_3d rule ensures that units of length and plane angle are given for every global_unit_assigned_context.
Each global_unit_assigned_context shall have at least two elements in its set of units.
Each global_unit_assigned_context shall have exactly one length_unit and exactly one plane_angle_unit.

The externally_defined_class_with_known_source_requirement rule specifies that each instance of externally_defined_class which references as the source a known_source is contained in the set of items of exactly one applied_organization_assignment which references as its role an organization_role with a name of 'class supplier'. This rule enforces the requirement for every Plib_class_reference to have a supplier_bsu.

Each instance of externally_defined_class which references as the source a known_source shall be member in the set of items of an applied_organization_assignment. This organization_assignment shall reference as its role an organization_role with a name of 'class supplier'.
The restrict_name_for_known_source rule ensures that each instance of known_source has a name of 'ISO 13584 library'.
Each instance of known_source shall have a name of 'ISO 13584 library'.

The plib_class_reference_requires_version rule specifies that each instance of externally_defined_class that has as its source a known_source is contained in the set of items of exactly one applied_external_identification_assignment which references as its role an identification_role with a name of 'version'.
This rule enforces the requirement for every Plib_class_reference to have exactly one version.

Each instance of externally_defined_class that has as its source a known_source is contained in the set of items of exactly one applied_external_identification_assignment which references as its role an identification_role with a name of 'version'.

An instance of externally_defined_class that has as its source a known_source may not be contained in the set of items of an applied_identification_assignment which references as its role an identification_role with a name of 'version'.

The person_requires_person_and_organization rule ensures that each instance of person shall be referenced by at least one instance of person_and_organization as the_person.
This rule enforces the requirement for each person to have at least one organization specified the person belongs to.
Each instance of person shall be referenced by at least one instance of person_and_organization as the_person.

The restrict_applied_event_occurrence_assignment rule ensures that each instance of applied_event_occurrence_assignment that provides the context for an event_occurrence contains exactly one element in its set of items.
Each applied_event_occurrence_assignment that has a role with a name of 'event context' shall contain exactly one element in its set of items.

The restrict_applied_organizational_project_assignment rule enforces the correct correlation between the types of items in the set of items of an applied_organizational_project_assignment and its associated object_role.
If the role has a name of 'affecting project', only items of type product_concept shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'work program', only items of type executed_action shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_approval rule specifies the constraints that apply to an approval and to an approval_date_time in the context of this application module.
Each approval shall be referenced by at most two approval_date_time.
Each approval_date_time shall have an object_role. This object_role shall have a name of either 'actual' or 'planned'.
Each approval shall be referenced by at most one approval_date_time that has a name of 'actual'.
Each approval shall be referenced by at most one approval_date_time that has a name of 'planned'.

The restrict_class_system_assignment_for_approval_status rule specifies that each instance of approval_status shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment that specifies the classification system for the approval_status.
For each instance of approval_status there shall be only at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment with a role name of 'class system membership'.

The restrict_class_system_assignment_for_class rule specifies that each instance of class shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment that specifies the classification system for the class.
For each instance of class there shall be only at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment with a role name of 'class system membership' that references that instance of class.

The restrict_class_system_assignment_for_descriptive_representation_item rule specifies that each instance of descriptive_representation_item shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment that specifies the classification system for the descriptive_representation_item.
For each instance of descriptive_representation_item there shall be only at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment with a role name of 'class system membership'.

The restrict_class_system_assignment_for_document_type rule specifies that each instance of document_type shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment that specifies the classification system for the document_type.
For each instance of document_type there shall be only at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment with a role name of 'class system membership'.

The restrict_class_system_assignment_for_planar_extent rule specifies that each instance of planar_extent with a name of 'size format' shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment that specifies the referenced standard of the document format.
For each instance of planar_extent with a name of 'size format' there shall be at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment with a role name of 'class system membership'.

The restrict_class_system_assignment_for_security_classification_level rule specifies that each instance of security_classification_level shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment that specifies the classification system for the security_classification_level.
For each instance of security_classification_level there shall be only at most one instance of applied_classification_assignment with a role name of 'class system membership'.

The restrict_configuration_design_for_specified_individual rule enforces the restrictions that apply to the usage of a configuration_design when it relates to a configuration_item which references as its item_concept a product_identification.

Each instance of configuration_design which has a name of 'physical instance basis' shall reference as design a product_definition which references as its frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'physical occurrence'.
Each instance of configuration_design which has a name of 'physical instance basis' shall reference as configuration a configuration_item of type product_identification.
The restrict_date_assignment rule constrains instances of applied_date_assignment when role name is 'actual end'.
For any instance of applied_date_assignment, if the role has a name of 'actual end', only items of type organizational_project, or effectivity shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_document_reference rule constrains instances of applied_document_reference with role name 'general tolerance definition'.
For any instance of applied_document_reference, if the role has a name of 'general tolerance definition', only items of type representation shall be in the set of items.

For any instance of applied_document_reference, if the name of the role is not 'general tolerance definition', only items of type approval, certification, class, class_system, configuration_design, configuration_item, contract, feature_definition, general_property, material_designation, organization, organizational_project, person, product_concept, product_concept_feature, product_concept_feature_category, product_definition, product_definition_formation, product_definition_formation_relationship, product_definition_relationship, product_definition_substitute, product_related_product_category, property_definition, representation, resource_requirement_type, security_classification, shape_aspect, shape_aspect_relationship shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_effectivity_assignment_for_class_category_usage rule restricts the usage of product_concept_feature_category_usage objects in an applied_effectivity_assignment.

An applied_effectivity_assignment which has a product_concept_feature_category_usage in its set of items may only have other product_concept_feature_category_usage objects in its set of items.
It shall have an assigned_effectivity which is not of an effectivity subtype and which has an id of 'class usage' and it shall be the assigned_effectivity_assignment of a class_usage_effectivity_context_assignment.
The restrict_effectivity_for_effectivity_relationship rule restricts the types of effectivity that may participate in an effectivity_relationship.
The relating_effectivity and the related_effectivity of an effectivity_relationship may not be of type lot_effectivity, serial_numbered_effectivity, or product_definition_effectivity .

The restrict_effectivity_usage rule enforces the usage of an effectivity that is not a dated_effectivity or a time_interval_based_effectivity by at least one instance of applied_effectivity_assignment or effectivity_relationship. An effectivity that is not a dated_effectivity or a time_interval_based_effectivity, shall either be used at least once as the related_effectivity by an effectivity_relationship with a name of 'inheritance', or it shall have an id of 'configuration validity' and be the assigned_effectivity of a configured_effectivity_assignment or it shall have an id of 'class usage' and be the assigned_effectivity of an applied_effectivity_assignment which has a product_concept_feature_category_usage in its set of items.

An effectivity that is not a dated_effectivity or a time_interval_based_effectivity, shall either be used at least once as the related_effectivity by an effectivity_relationship with a name of 'inheritance', or it shall have an id of 'configuration validity' and be the assigned_effectivity of a configured_effectivity_assignment or it shall have an id of 'class usage' and be the assigned_effectivity of an applied_effectivity_assignment which has a product_concept_feature_category_usage in its set of items.
The restrict_externally_defined_item_relationship rule ensures the correct correlation between the name of an externally_defined_item_relationship and the related externally_defined_items.

If an externally_defined_item_relationship has a name of 'name scope', the relating_item shall be of type externally_defined_general_property and shall reference as the source a known_source and the related_item shall be of type externally_defined_class and shall reference as its source a known_source.
The restrict_external_identification_assignment rule constrains instances of applied_external_identification_assignment according to their role name.
If the role has a name of 'alternative document id and location', only items of type document_file shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'version', only items of type externally_defined_class, or externally_defined_general_property shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_group_assignment rule constrains instances of applied_group_assignment according to their role name.
If the role has a name of 'group membership', only items of type geometric_representation_item or shape_aspect shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'group membership', the set of items shall include either objects of type geometric_representation_item or shape_aspect.

The restrict_multi_language_for_alternate_product_relationship rule specifies that each instance of alternate_product_relationship shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'basis'.
There shall not be any instance of alternate_product_relationship for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_application_context rule specifies that each instance of application_context shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description'.
There shall not be any instance of application_context for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_approval_relationship rule specifies that each instance of approval_relationship shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description'.
There shall not be any instance of approval_relationship for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of assembly_component_usage_substitute for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_certification rule specifies that each instance of certification shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is either 'name' or 'purpose'.

The restrict_multi_language_for_configuration_design rule specifies that each instance of configuration_design shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description'.
There shall not be any instance of configuration_design for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of configuration_item for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of contract for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_data_environment rule specifies that each instance of data_environment shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description'.
There shall not be any instance of data_environment for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_date_role rule specifies that each instance of date_role shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description'.
There shall not be any instance of date_role for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of date_time_role for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of descriptive_representation_item for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of document_relationship for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of effectivity for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of effectivity_relationship for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of event_occurrence for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of external_source for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of general_property for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of general_property_relationship for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of geometric_representation_item for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_group rule specifies that each instance of group shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description' or 'name'.
There shall not be any instance of group for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_group_relationship rule specifies that each instance of group_relationship shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description'.
There shall not be any instance of group_relationship for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of identification_role for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of mapped_item for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of organization_relationship for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of organization_role for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of organizational_project for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of organizational_project_relationship for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of person_and_organization_role for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of product for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of product_concept_feature_association for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of product_concept_relationship for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of product_definition for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of product_definition_formation_relationship for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of security_classification for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

There shall not be any instance of shape_aspect for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_shape_aspect_relationship rule specifies that each instance of shape_aspect_relationship shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description'.
There shall not be any instance of shape_aspect_relationship for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_time_interval_role rule specifies that each instance of time_interval_role shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description'.
There shall not be any instance of time_interval_role for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_uncertainty_measure_with_unit rule specifies that each instance of uncertainty_measure_with_unit shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description'.
There shall not be any instance of uncertainty_measure_with_unit for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.

The restrict_multi_language_for_uncertainty_qualifier rule specifies that each instance of uncertainty_qualifier shall only be referenced by instances of multi_language_attribute_assignment or attribute_language_assignment that have an attribute attribute_name that is 'description'.
There shall not be any instance of uncertainty_qualifier for which assignments of language indication or translation texts are not assigned correctly to the translatable attributes.
The restrict_name_for_known_source rule ensures that each instance of known_source has a name of 'ISO 13584 library'.
Each instance of known_source shall have a name of 'ISO 13584 library'.
The restrict_organization_assignment rule constrains the instances of applied_organization_assignment.
If the role has a name of 'organization in contract', only items of type contract shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'signing for contract', only items of type applied_organization_assignment shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'validity context', only items of type action_property, resource_property, or property_definition shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'validity context', only items of type action_property, resource_property, or property_definition shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_person_and_organization_assignment rule constrains the instances of applied_person_and_organization_assignment.
If the role has a name of 'signing for contract', only items of type applied_organization_assignment shall be in the set of items.

The restrict_product_categories_for_tool_part_relationship rule constrains instances of product_definition_relationship as follows: for each instance of product_definition_relationship that has a name of 'tool part relationship', the product_definition used as the relating_product_definition shall be associated to a product_definition_formation referencing a product that is referenced by a product_related_product_category with a name of 'tool'. The product_definition used as the related_product_definition shall be associated to a product_definition_formation referencing a product that is referenced by a product_related_product_category with a name of 'part'.

For each instance of product_definition_relationship that has a name of 'tool part relationship', the product_definition used as the relating_product_definition shall be associated to a product_definition_formation referencing a product that is referenced by a product_related_product_category with a name of 'tool'. The product_definition used as the related_product_definition shall be associated to a product_definition_formation referencing a product that is referenced by a product_related_product_category with a name of 'part'.

The restrict_product_category_for_product rule enforces the existence of a product_related_product_category with a name of either 'part', 'raw material', 'tool', 'document', 'functionality', 'conceptual product, 'alternative solution', 'requirement' for each product.

Each instance of product shall be referenced by a product_related_product_category with a name of either 'part', 'raw material', 'tool', 'document', 'functionality', 'conceptual product', 'alternative solution', 'requirement'.

The restrict_product_definition_context_for_external_properties rule specifies that a product_definition which is referrenced as the definition by a property_definition which itself is refrerenced as the derived_definition by a general_property_association that references as the base_definition an externally_defined_general_property, shall be referenced as the definition by a product_definition_context_association which has as the frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'external' and which references as its role a product_definition_context_role with a name of 'external'.

Each instance of product_definition which is referrenced as the definition by a property_definition which itself is refrerenced as the derived_definition by a general_property_association that references as the base_definition an externally_defined_general_property, shall be referenced as the definition by a product_definition_context_association which has as the frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'external' and which references as its role a product_definition_context_role with a name of 'external'.

The restrict_product_definition_context_for_product rule ensures the correct correlation between the name of the product_definition_context which is referenced as the frame_of_reference by a product_definition and the product_related_product_category of the associated product.

If the product_definition references as its frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'functional definition', this product_definition shall reference as its formation a product_definition_formation which references as of_product a product which is in the set of products of a product_related_product_category with a name of 'functionality'.

If the product_definition references as its frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'conceptual definition', this product_definition shall reference as its formation a product_definition_formation which references as of_product a product which is in the set of products of a product_related_product_category with a name of 'conceptual product'.

If the product_definition references as its frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'physical document definition', 'digital document definition', or 'physical model occurrence', this product_definition shall reference as its formation a product_definition_formation which references as of_product a product which is in the set of products of a product_related_product_category with a name of 'document'.
The restrict_product_definition_substitute rule specifies the restrictions that apply to the usage of product_definition_substitute .

For each instance of product_definition_substitute there shall be at least one instance of applied_effectivity_assignment that contains the instance in its set of items. This rule enforces the requirement for every instance of Replaced_usage_relationship to have at least one Effectivity applied to it specifiying the start of the validity of the replacement.

Each instance of product_definition_substitute shall reference as substitute_definition a product_definition which references as frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'part occurrence'.

Each instance of product_definition_substitute shall reference as context_relationship an assembly_component_usage which is referenced as occurrence_usage by a product_definition_occurrence_relationship, or shall reference as context_relationship a product_definition_relationship with a related_product_definition which references as its frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'part occurrence'.

The restrict_product_definitions_for_product_definition_relationship rule ensures the correct correlation between the name or type of the product_definition_relationship and the product_definition_context of the related product_definitions.

If the product_definition_relationship is of type assembly_component_usage, the relating_product_definition and the related_product_definition shall either both reference as their frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'part definition', or shall both reference as their frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'physical occurrence'.

If the product_definition_relationship has a name of 'physical realization', the relating_product_definition shall reference as its frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'part definition', and the related_product_definition shall reference as its frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'physical occurrence'.

If the product_definition_relationship has a name of 'physical occurrence usage', it shall be of type assembly_component_usage and both the relating_product_definition and the related_product_definition shall reference as frame_of_reference a product_definition_context with a name of 'physical occurrence' .
The restrict_properties_of_document_file rule specifies the restrictions that apply for properties of digital_files.
Each instance of document_file shall be referenced as definition by at most one property_definition with a name of 'document property'.
Each instance of document_file shall reference as representation_types an instance of document_representation_type with a name of either 'digital', or 'physical'.
The restrict_properties_of_document_representation rule specifies the restrictions that apply for properties of document_representations.

Each instance of product_definition that references as frame_of_reference a application_context_element with a name of either 'physical document definition', 'digital document definition', or 'physical model occurrence' shall be referenced as definition by at most one property_definition with a name of 'document property'.
The restrict_representation_for_document_content_property rule specifies the restrictions that apply for representations with a name of 'document content'.
For each instance of representation which has a name of 'document content' there shall be at least one and at most three instances of representation_items in the set of items.

Each instance of representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document content' shall have a name of either 'detail level', 'geometry type', or 'real world scale'.

There shall be at most one instance of representation_item that have a name of 'detail level' and which is of type desriptive_representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document content'.

There shall be at most one instance of representation_item that have a name of 'geometry type' and which is of type desriptive_representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document content'.

There shall be at most one instance of representation_item that have a name of 'real world scale' and which is either of type measure_representation_item, or value_representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document content'.
The restrict_representation_for_document_creation_property rule specifies the restrictions that apply for representations with a name of 'document creation'.
For each instance of representation which has a name of 'document creation' there shall be at least one and at most three instances of representation_items in the set of items.

Each instance of representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document creation' shall have a name of either 'creating interface', 'creating system', or 'operating system'.

There shall be at most one instance of representation_item that have a name of 'creating interface' and which is of type desriptive_representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document creation'.

There shall be exactly one instance of representation_item that have a name of 'creating system' and which is of type desriptive_representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document creation'.

There shall be at most one instance of representation_item that have a name of 'operating system' and which is of type desriptive_representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document creation'.
The restrict_representation_for_document_format_property rule specifies the restrictions that apply for representations with a name of 'document format'.
For each instance of representation which has a name of 'document format' there shall be at least one and at most three instances of representation_items in the set of items.
Each instance of representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document format' shall have a name of either 'character code', or 'data format'.

There shall be at most one instance of representation_item that have a name of 'character code' and which is of type desriptive_representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document format'.

There shall be at most one instance of representation_item that have a name of 'data format' and which is of type desriptive_representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document format'.

There shall be at most one instance of representation_item that have a name of 'size format' and which is of type planar_extent that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document format'.

The restrict_representation_for_document_properties rule specifies that each instance of property_definition with a name of 'document property' shall be represented by representations with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size'.
At the same time, this rules enforces that each instance of representation with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size', shall be referenced by one instance of property_definition with a name of 'document property'.

Each instance of property_definition with a name of 'document property' shall be referenced as definition by a property_definition_representation, which has as used_representation a representation with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size'.

Each instance of representation with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size' shall be referenced as used_representation by a property_definition_representation, which has as definition a property_definition with a name of 'document property'.

Each instance of representation with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size' shall reference as context_of_items a representation_context, whith a context_type of 'document parameters'.

Each instance of representation_context with a context_type of 'document parameters' shall be referenced as context_of_items by a representation with a name of either 'document content', 'document creation', 'document format', or 'document size'.
The restrict_representation_for_document_size_property rule specifies the restrictions that apply for representations with a name of 'document size'.
For each instance of representation which has a name of 'document size' there shall be at least one and at most two instances of representation_items in the set of items.
Each instance of representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document size' shall have a name of either 'file size', or 'page count'.

There shall be at most one instance of representation_item that have a name of 'file size' and which is either of type measure_representation_item, value_range, or value_representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document size'.

There shall be at most one instance of representation_item that have a name of 'page count' and which is either of type measure_representation_item, value_range, or value_representation_item that is referenced as items by an instance of representation with a name of 'document size'.

The restrict_version_assignment_for_applied_identification_assignment rule specifies that each instance of applied_identification_assignment shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment that specifies the version of the applied_identification_assignment.
For each instance of applied_identification_assignment there shall be only at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment with a role name of 'version'.

The restrict_version_assignment_for_class rule specifies that each instance of class shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment that specifies the version of the class.
For each instance of class there shall be only at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment with a role name of 'version'.

The restrict_version_assignment_for_configuration_item rule specifies that each instance of configuration_item shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment that specifies the version of the configuration_item.
For each instance of configuration_item there shall be only at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment with a role name of 'version'.

The restrict_version_assignment_for_document_file rule specifies that each instance of document_file shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment that specifies the version of the document_file.
For each instance of document_file there shall be only at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment with a role name of 'version'.

The restrict_version_assignment_for_effectivity rule specifies that each instance of effectivity shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment that specifies the version of the effectivity.
For each instance of effectivity there shall be only at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment with a role name of 'version'.

The restrict_version_assignment_for_general_property rule specifies that each instance of general_property shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment that specifies the version of the general_property.
For each instance of general_property there shall be only at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment with a role name of 'version'.

The restrict_version_assignment_for_product_concept rule specifies that each instance of product_concept shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment that specifies the version of the product_concept.
For each instance of product_concept there shall be only at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment with a role name of 'version'.

The restrict_version_assignment_for_product_concept_feature rule specifies that each instance of product_concept_feature shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment that specifies the version of the product_concept_feature.
For each instance of product_concept_feature there shall be only at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment with a role name of 'version'.

The restrict_version_assignment_for_shape_representation rule specifies that each instance of shape_representation shall be referenced by at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment that specifies the version of the shape_representation.
For each instance of shape_representation there shall be only at most one instance of applied_identification_assignment with a role name of 'version'.

The security_classification_requires_security_classification_assignment rule specifies that each instance of security_classification is referenced by at least one instance of security_classification_assignment as the assigned_security_classification.
This rule enforces the requirement for every security_classification to be applied at least once.
Each instance of security_classification shall be used at least once as the assigned_security_classification by an instance of security_classification_assignment.
The subtype_exclusiveness_characterized_object rule specifies that the subtypes of characterized_object are mutually exclusive.

Each instance of the subtypes of an characterized_object shall be only one of characterized_class, document_file, feature_component_definition, feature_definition, product_class, product_identification.
The subtype_exclusiveness_classification_assignment rule specifies that the subtypes of classification_assignment are mutually exclusive.
Each instance of the subtypes of an classification_assignment shall be only one of applied_classification_assignment, language_assignment.
The subtype_exclusiveness_compound_representation_item rule specifies that the subtypes of compound_representation_item are mutually exclusive.
Each instance of the subtypes of an compound_representation_item shall be only one of default_tolerance_table_cell, value_range.
The subtype_exclusiveness_document_reference rule specifies that the subtypes of document_reference are mutually exclusive.
Each instance of the subtypes of an document_reference shall be only one of applied_document_reference, draughting_specification_reference.
The subtype_exclusiveness_effectivity rule specifies that the subtypes of effectivity are mutually exclusive, except for dated_effevtivity, lot_effectivity, and serial_numbered_effectivity.
Each instance of the subtypes of an effectivity shall be only one of product_definition_effectivity, time_interval_based_effectivity.
The subtype_exclusiveness_effectivity_assignment rule specifies that the subtypes of effectivity_assignment are mutually exclusive.
Each instance of the subtypes of an effectivity_assignment shall be only one of applied_effectivity_assignment, applied_ineffectivity_assignment, configured_effectivity_assignment.
The subtype_exclusiveness_effectivity_context_assignment rule specifies that the subtypes of effectivity_context_assignment are mutually exclusive.
Each instance of the subtypes of an effectivity_context_assignment shall be only one of class_usage_effectivity_context_assignment, configured_effectivity_context_assignment.
The subtype_exclusiveness_externally_defined_item rule specifies that the subtypes of externally_defined_item are mutually exclusive.

Each instance of the subtypes of an externally_defined_item shall be only one of externally_defined_character_glyph, externally_defined_class, externally_defined_curve_font, externally_defined_feature_definition, externally_defined_general_property, externally_defined_hatch_style, externally_defined_style, externally_defined_symbol, externally_defined_text_font, externally_defined_tile_style.
The subtype_exclusiveness_group rule specifies that the subtypes of group are mutually exclusive.
Each instance of the subtypes of an group shall be only one of class, class_system, language, product_concept_feature_category, rep_item_group.
The subtype_exclusiveness_group_assignment rule specifies that the subtypes of group_assignment are mutually exclusive.
Each instance of the subtypes of an group_assignment shall be only one of applied_group_assignment, product_concept_feature_category_usage.
The subtype_exclusiveness_identification_assignment rule specifies that the subtypes of identification_assignment are mutually exclusive.
Each instance of the subtypes of an identification_assignment shall be only one of applied_identification_assignment, external_identification_assignment.
The subtype_exclusiveness_property_definition rule specifies that the subtypes of property_definition are mutually exclusive.
Each instance of the subtypes of an property_definition shall be only one of kinematic_property_definition, material_property, product_definition_shape.
The subtype_exclusiveness_property_definition_representation rule specifies that the subtypes of property_definition_representation are mutually exclusive.

Each instance of the subtypes of an property_definition_representation shall be only one of kinematic_property_representation_relation, material_property_representation, shape_definition_representation.
The subtype_exclusiveness_representation rule specifies that the subtypes of representation are mutually exclusive, except for uncertainty_assigned_representation.

Each instance of the subtypes of an representation shall be only one of constructive_geometry_representation, contact_ratio_representation, default_tolerance_table, definitional_representation, direction_shape_representation, draughting_model, founded_kinematic_path, hardness_representation, kinematic_frame_background_representation, kinematic_ground_representation, kinematic_link_representation, mechanical_design_geometric_presentation_representation, moments_of_inertia_representation, presentation_representation, shape_representation, surface_texture_representation, symbol_representation, tactile_appearance_representation, text_string_representation, visual_appearance_representation.

The subtype_exclusiveness_representation_item rule specifies that the subtypes of representation_item are mutually exclusive, except for geometric_representation_item, mapped_item, qualified_representation_item, styled_item, and topological_representation_item.
Each instance of the subtypes of an representation_item shall be only one of compound_representation_item, measure_representation_item, rep_item_group, value_representation_item.
The subtype_mandatory_address rule ensures that all address entities are of type organizational_address and/or personal_address.
Each instance of address shall be of type organizational_address and/or personal_address.
The subtype_mandatory_configurable_item rule ensures that all configurable_item entities are of type product_specification.
Each configurable_item shall be of type product_specification.
The subtype_mandatory_document_product_association rule ensures that all document_product_association entities are of type document_product_equivalence.
Each document_product_association shall be of type document_product_equivalence.

The subtype_mandatory_externally_defined_item rule ensures that all externally_defined_item entities are of type externally_defined_character_glyph, externally_defined_class, externally_defined_curve_font, externally_defined_feature_definition, externally_defined_general_property, externally_defined_hatch_style, externally_defined_style, externally_defined_symbol, externally_defined_text_font, or externally_defined_tile_style.

Each externally_defined_item shall be either a externally_defined_character_glyph, externally_defined_class, externally_defined_curve_font, externally_defined_feature_definition, externally_defined_general_property, externally_defined_hatch_style, externally_defined_style, externally_defined_symbol, externally_defined_text_font, or externally_defined_tile_style.

The at_most_one_class_system function evaluates for an instance of any type if there is more than one applied_classification_assignment with role name 'class system membership'. If there is more than one of such of applied_classification_assignment, the function returns FALSE.
the instance that is considered.

The at_most_one_version_id function evaluates for an instance of any type if there is more than one applied_identification_assignment with role name 'version'. If there is more than one of such of applied_classification_assignment, the function returns FALSE.
the instance that is considered.

The item_correlation function accepts a set of GENERIC and a set of STRING as input and returns a boolean result.
The function will return TRUE if all elements of the first set are in the set of types that is generated from the second set. Else it will return FALSE.
the set of instances that is considered.
the set of entity names compared with the type of the element of items.

The allowed_translations function checks for an instance if language indication and translations are provided correctly and for the right attributes. In that case, it returns TRUE else it returns FALSE.
the instance that is considered.
the set of names of attributes for which a language indication or a translation is allowed.
